category.catDesc: Used to denote a date calculated by the editor from a regnal year or some other dating method given in the text.

person.persName: Those with Asterius when he met with Severus
Flavian, prelate of the city of Antiochus

occupation.note: Flavian was a prelate of Antioch.

person.persName: Patrick, the Master of the Soldiers

occupation.note: Patrick was Master of the Soldiers.

personGrp.persName: Those who met together at the Council of Chalcedon

person.persName: Epiphanius, the Bishop of Magydum in Pamphylia

occupation.note: Epiphanius was bishop of Magydum in Pamphylia .

nationality.note: Epiphanius was a citizen of Perga.

socecStatus.note: Epiphanius was a noble by birth.

occupation.note: Peter of Iberia was Bishop of one of the cities in Palestine.

personGrp.persName: The holy fathers and orthodox persons of Palestine who, along with Peter the Iberian , persuaded Epiphanius to perform ordinations in Palestine

person.persName: Priests ordained by Eusebius, the Bishop of Samosata outside his jurisdiction during a time of persecution.
Basil, Bishop of Caesarea in Cappadocia
The great light of the Cappadocians

occupation.note: Basil was Bishop of Caesarea in Cappadocia .

personGrp.persName: The bishops from outside of Cappadocia who ordained Basil bishop

event.desc: Between 508 and 511, Severuswrote a letter toConstantine the bishopabout the ordination of bishops and clergy in the wake of the Council of Chalcedon.
Asterius the Bishopandthose with himcame toSeverusinAntioch.
Emperor Anastasiussent his formula of satisfaction toFlavian, prelate of Antioch.
John ofClaudiopolis, when he receivedSeverusin the house ofPatrick, urgedSeverusto receive the synod ofChalcedon, not as a positive definition of faith, but as a rejection ofNestoriusandEutyches.

event.ana: http://syriaca.org/keyword/anti-nestorian http://syriaca.org/keyword/council-of-Chalcedon-451 http://syriaca.org/keyword/anathema http://syriaca.org/keyword/theology http://syriaca.org/keyword/bishops http://syriaca.org/keyword/anti-chalcedonian http://syriaca.org/keyword/arianism http://syriaca.org/keyword/heresy http://syriaca.org/keyword/clergy
event.desc: Severusresponded toJohnby refusing to accept the synod ofChalcedonas a repudiation ofNestoriusandEutyches, because the Chalcedonian creed and the Tome ofLeosupport Nestorianism; Severusdoes not believe that anathematizingEutychesmakes the Council ofChalcedonlegitimate, because the followers ofAriuswere still heretics even though they repudiated the teachings of Sabellius.
Severusrecalled thatEpiphaniushad been brought up in the monasteries ofPerga, practicing a life of virginity.

event.ana: http://syriaca.org/keyword/exile http://syriaca.org/keyword/heresy http://syriaca.org/keyword/council-of-Chalcedon-451 http://syriaca.org/keyword/eucharist http://syriaca.org/keyword/bishops http://syriaca.org/keyword/clergy http://syriaca.org/keyword/travel http://syriaca.org/keyword/persecution
event.desc: WhenTimothyhad endured his exile fromAlexandria,Epiphaniusleft his bishopric inMagydumand came toAlexandria, embracing communion withTimothy.
AfterTimothyhad died and the orthodox began enduring persecution again,Epiphaniuswithdrew to Palestinewhere he met withPeter ofIberiaand began ordaining priests.

event.ana: http://syriaca.org/keyword/ordination http://syriaca.org/keyword/canon-law http://syriaca.org/keyword/greek-fathers http://syriaca.org/keyword/arianism http://syriaca.org/keyword/heresy http://syriaca.org/keyword/bishops
event.desc: Severusargued that by ordaining priests in a diocese that was not his own,Epiphaniuswas not violating the sacred canons, which only outlaws such behavior in the cases of bishops forcing themselves on other dioceses, citing the examples ofEusebius ofSamosataduring the controversy ofArius,Theodoret,Basil, andGregory the Theologian.
Severusbelieved that he had convincedJohnto not affirm the council ofChalcedon.
SeverusencouragedConstantineto follow his teaching and the advice ofPeter the Presbyterand to be alert for John'sblacksiding.

bibl.title: The Sixth Book of the Select Letters of Severus, Patriarch of Antioch in the Syriac Version of Athanasius of Nisibis
Translation, I.1 - II.3
